detaileddescription.para: Channel name (1-100 characters)
Channel topic (0-4096 characters for forum and media channels, 0-1024 characters for all others)

briefdescription.para: Voice region if set for voice channel, otherwise empty string.

detaileddescription.para: DM recipients
Permission overwrites to apply to base permissions
A set of tags that can be used in a forum or media channel

briefdescription.para: The emoji to show as the default reaction button on a thread in a forum or media channel. Contains either nothing, the id of a guild's custom emoji or the unicode character of the emoji.
Channel icon (for group DMs)

detaileddescription.para: User ID of the creator for group DMs or threads
Parent ID (for guild channels: id of the parent category, for threads: id of the text channel this thread was created)
Guild id of the guild that owns the channel
ID of last message to be sent to the channel (may not point to an existing or valid message or thread)
Timestamp of last pinned message

briefdescription.para: This is only filled when the channel is part of the resolved set sent within an interaction. Any other time it contains zero. When filled, it contains the calculated permission bitmask of the user issuing the command within this channel.

detaileddescription.para: Sorting position, lower number means higher up the list
the bitrate (in kilobits) of the voice channel
amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected
The initial rate_limit_per_user to set on newly created threads in a channel. This field is copied to the thread at creation time and does not live update

briefdescription.para: Default duration, copied onto newly created threads. Used by the clients, not the API. Threads will stop showing in the channel list after the specified period of inactivity. Defaults to dpp::arc_1_day.

detaileddescription.para: the default sort order type used to order posts in forum and media channels
Flags bitmap (dpp::channel_flags)
Maximum user limit for voice channels (0-99)

briefdescription.para: Unique ID of object set by Discord. This value contains a timestamp, worker ID, internal server ID, and an incrementing value. Only the timestamp is relevant to us as useful metadata.

detaileddescription.para:
Read class values from json object
j
A json object to read from
A reference to self

briefdescription.para: Build json for this channel object.

parameterdescription.para: include the ID in the json

simplesect.para: json JSON object

memberdef.argsstring: (const snowflake target, const overwrite_type type, const uint64_t allowed_permissions, const uint64_t denied_permissions)
memberdef.name: add_permission_overwrite

briefdescription.para: Add permission overwrites for a user or role. If the channel already has permission overwrites for the passed target, the existing ones will be adjusted by the passed permissions.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the role or the member you want to adjust overwrites for
bitmask of dpp::permissions you want to allow for this user/role in this channel. Note: You can use the dpp::permission class
bitmask of dpp::permissions you want to deny for this user/role in this channel. Note: You can use the dpp::permission class

simplesect.para: Reference to self, so these method calls may be chained

memberdef.argsstring: (const snowflake target, const overwrite_type type, const uint64_t allowed_permissions, const uint64_t denied_permissions)
memberdef.name: set_permission_overwrite

briefdescription.para: Set permission overwrites for a user or role on this channel object. Old permission overwrites for the target will be overwritten.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the role or the member you want to set overwrites for
bitmask of allowed dpp::permissions for this user/role in this channel. Note: You can use the dpp::permission class
bitmask of denied dpp::permissions for this user/role in this channel. Note: You can use the dpp::permission class

simplesect.para: Reference to self, so these method calls may be chained
If both allowed_permissions and denied_permissions parameters are 0, the permission overwrite for the target will be removed

briefdescription.para: Remove channel specific permission overwrites of a user or role.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the role or the member you want to remove permission overwrites of

simplesect.para: Reference to self, so these method calls may be chained

briefdescription.para: Get the channel type.

simplesect.para: channel_type Channel type

briefdescription.para: Get the default forum layout type used to display posts in forum channels.

simplesect.para: forum_layout_types Forum layout type

briefdescription.para: Get the mention ping for the channel.

simplesect.para: std::string mention

briefdescription.para: Get the overall permissions for a member in this channel, including channel overwrites, role permissions and admin privileges.

parameterdescription.para: The user to resolve the permissions for

simplesect.para: permission Permission overwrites for the member. Made of bits in dpp::permissions.
Requires role cache to be enabled (it's enabled by default).
This is an alias for guild::permission_overwrites and searches for the guild in the cache, so consider using guild::permission_overwrites if you already have the guild object.
The method will search for the guild member in the cache by the users id. If the guild member is not in cache, the method will always return 0.

briefdescription.para: Get the overall permissions for a member in this channel, including channel overwrites, role permissions and admin privileges.

parameterdescription.para: The member to resolve the permissions for

simplesect.para: permission Permission overwrites for the member. Made of bits in dpp::permissions.
Requires role cache to be enabled (it's enabled by default).
This is an alias for guild::permission_overwrites and searches for the guild in the cache, so consider using guild::permission_overwrites if you already have the guild object.

briefdescription.para: Return a map of members on the channel, built from the guild's member list based on which members have the VIEW_CHANNEL permission. Does not return reliable information for voice channels, use dpp::channel::get_voice_members() instead for this.

simplesect.para: A map of guild members keyed by user id.
If the guild this channel belongs to is not in the cache, the function will always return 0.

briefdescription.para: Get a map of members in this channel, if it is a voice channel. The map is keyed by snowflake id of the user.

simplesect.para: std::map<snowflake, voicestate> The voice members of the channel

briefdescription.para: Get the channel's icon url (if its a group DM), otherwise returns an empty string.

parameterdescription.para: The size of the icon in pixels. It can be any power of two between 16 and 4096, otherwise the default sized icon is returned.
The format to use for the avatar. It can be one of i_webp, i_jpg or i_png.

simplesect.para: std::string icon url or an empty string, if required attributes are missing or an invalid format was passed

briefdescription.para: Returns string of URL to channel.

simplesect.para: string of URL to channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is NSFW gated.

simplesect.para: true if NSFW

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the permissions are to be synced with the category it is in. Used only and set manually when using the reorder channels method.

simplesect.para: true if keeping permissions

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a text channel.

simplesect.para: true if text channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a DM.

simplesect.para: true if is a DM

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a voice channel.

simplesect.para: true if voice channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a group DM channel.

simplesect.para: true if group DM

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a category.

simplesect.para: true if a category

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a forum.

simplesect.para: true if a forum

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a media channel.

simplesect.para: true if media channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is an announcement channel.

simplesect.para: true if announcement channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a store channel.

xrefdescription.para: store channels are deprecated by Discord

simplesect.para: true if store channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the channel is a stage channel.

simplesect.para: true if stage channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if video quality is auto.

simplesect.para: true if video quality is auto

briefdescription.para: Returns true if video quality is 720p.

simplesect.para: true if video quality is 720p

briefdescription.para: Returns true if channel is a pinned thread in forum.

simplesect.para: true, if channel is a pinned thread in forum

briefdescription.para: Returns true if a tag is required to be specified when creating a thread in a forum channel.

simplesect.para: true, if a tag is required to be specified when creating a thread in a forum channel

briefdescription.para: Returns true if embedded media download options are hidden in a media channel.

simplesect.para: true, if embedded media download options are hidden in a media channel

briefdescription.para: Get the creation time of this object according to Discord.

simplesect.para: double creation time inferred from the snowflake ID. The minimum possible value is the first second of 2015.

briefdescription.para: Comparison operator for comparing two managed objects by id.

simplesect.para: true objects are the same id
false objects are not the same id

briefdescription.para: Comparison operator for comparing two managed objects by id.

simplesect.para: true objects are not the same id
false objects are the same id

briefdescription.para: Convert object from nlohmann::json.

simplesect.para: T& Reference to self for fluent calling

briefdescription.para: Convert object to nlohmann::json.

parameterdescription.para: Whether to include the ID or not

simplesect.para: Some fields are conditionally filled, do not rely on all fields being present
json Json built from the structure

briefdescription.para: Convert object to json string.

parameterdescription.para: Whether to include the ID or not

simplesect.para: Some fields are conditionally filled, do not rely on all fields being present
std::string Json built from the structure

briefdescription.para: Create a mentionable channel.

simplesect.para: std::string The formatted mention of the channel.

briefdescription.para: A definition of a discord channel. There are one of these for every channel type except threads. Threads are special snowflakes. Get it? A Discord pun. Hahaha. .... I'll get my coat.
